text: my quick thoughts on how I’d see N cases working. let me know where the cracks are:
<@U06DFL7BP|charlesv> uploaded a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/charlesv/F07P5QC2K/Untitled.txt|Untitled>

file.name: Untitled.txt
file.title: Untitled
file.preview:
- Onboarding is based on which artist the just-activated case is for
- Theme for app is based on what case you have active (and can be overridden in preferences). Would need to add to onboarding as selection, on second+ artist
- Artist updates combines all unlocked artists, recycler view etc
- Shortcut button can be configured on a per-case basis - button configuration screen has an option for selecting which case style you are configuring (ie skrillex, Leto, artist X based on unlocked artists), and you can select the options therein. options carry with case styles
- Live wallpaper shows all unlocked artists in configuration, must be set explicitly, not tied to cases
file.preview_highlight:
- Onboarding is based on which artist the just-activated case is for
- Theme for app is based on what case you have active (and can be overridden in preferences). Would need to add to onboarding as selection, on second+ artist
- Artist updates combines all unlocked artists, recycler view etc
- Shortcut button can be configured on a per-case basis - button configuration screen has an option for selecting which case style you are configuring (ie skrillex, Leto, artist X based on unlocked artists), and you can select the options therein. options carry with case styles
- Live wallpaper shows all unlocked artists in configuration, must be set explicitly, not tied to cases

text: <@U06DFL7BP>: For the artist updates, do you see all artist updates in one list? or do you drill into it by selecting an artist first?
In my mind I’d see all combined?
or rather: whichever ends up being cleaner
it seems better from the single-artist perspective to only have one list and no drill in
I guess my point would be from a nav and presentation perspective, they’re always “available"
i think we could have them all combined in one list but maybe there is a way to collapse the info??
<@U02F9CXTL>: one list, but filter to only show X?
possibly - i can look for some google examples

"- Theme for app is based on what case you have active (and can be overridden in preferences)” 
- Does pressing a button on a new case update the app theme to the new artist?
- Does pressing a button on an old case change the theme?
my view would be there are N+1 options
Set to “always be artist X theme”, “artist Y theme” etc
or “Always set theme to the most recently activate case"
(ie this would be configured in an “app theme” preference)
oh - i like the preference option
I think by adding the theme to preferences, we’ll eventually have to add it as an option to onboarding
ie “set app theme to this case” or “keep my current option”?
yeah
…do we think that’s bad? :simple_smile:
not necessarily, just pointing it out
to me, extra steps = bad, but no one is really going to read it anyway, it’s just another button to press
would  only need to on second artists and later, though, right?
right
for a single artist you get whatever the case is
so it’s an extra step in onboarding, but solves the issue for the edge case
‘case'
turns out, there are lots of edge cases
one more question, are nfc options based on the case that you’re customizing?
or do you have access to all of the options no matter the case and/or theme
so the way I’d see NFC Button options working:
Go to NFC Button options
it shows the options for the current active case
you can also configure the options for the other cases via a dropdown or other selection
so you couldn’t have skrillex open leto
but you could configure leto while skrillex is on/active for when you do put it on, assuming it’s been activated
gotcha
I think it’s a solid recommendation. kinda tedious to implement, but they all will be.
it’d be nice to have some of these considerations recorded. There will come a point where they try to change everything, one detail at a time, slowly breaking it
this is all presuming we have one wallpaper exposed and all the configuraiton / selection happens in the app <_<,   >_>
oh, yes. i’d like to to talk through this with Adam and get buy in, write it up and get sign off and note that we can’t really change it without implications :simple_smile:
w/r/t our timeline discussions yesterday - what does the above change, if anything to the timeline for those changes?
(2 weeks of fulltime kat + 1 week for M + plus QA is what i had in my notes)
I don’t think it changes too much. There’s a little more UI updating than I had originally thought, but I think it’s still doable on the same timeline
that could change based on designs for the new ideas. some simple things will take longer than I’d like them to (for instance, fading between multiple artist images)
or we choose a generic artist image, or don’t fade, just cycle through
intent is just to not show only one artist
for sure, and I don’t think that one thing will change the timeline, but having several items like that might
<@U02F9CXTL>: from a UX perspective, can you look at the snippet above? <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/charlesv/F07P5QC2K/Untitled.txt>

Artist updates:
Fade between multiple artists that have been unlocked, take to combined artist views
what is this fading thing??
lol
just an idea!
on the home screen for the card that lists “skrillex updates” update to “artist updates” and for the image on the home screen, show images representing unlocked artists
ahh - cool
thats what i thought it might be for -
yeah we can play some stuff for that
updated to say ‘transition’ :simple_smile:

"Notifications: 
Only show notifications for unlocked artists (note: do we need an "all" category for"
i like an “all” option

i.e. the user would only receive (or rather we’d destroy that aren’t) notifications for artists they’ve unlocked, but there should be a “google” category or somesuch that would present across all artists, regardless of selection
just to separate out of artist-specific notifications, or need to send across all of them
W/r/T new timeline: should we think of solves for the app size
and specifically about preferences: allowing the user to change artist from prefs makes me nervous, but its something we have to solve
I actually think choosing from preferences is one of the more straightforward approaches, at least there is a hard value we can look at for the theme
yeah. thats true.
I had been assuming previously that we would only have one nfc action across all cases
they'd like it 1:1 case:action
I get it, but we’ll have to spend some time adding that in too
right.
basically we'll have to unroll my asynctask to pull the mime extra and make it sync
I was looking at that and workshop doesn’t use the async task
is it necessary?
its not necessary in workshop
as an async
it was async in livecase just because it was unclear as to what it was gonna be
and wasn't important that it completed
oh right
